intro: Cerastium glabratum subsp. glabratum, commonly known as the glabrous mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically features dense clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are small, rounded, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
